If you trust your=
 eyes more than computers, you are probably in the wrong
industry :-)

> so=
 I'm always trying to check up on what I
> think is going on... this is dou=
bly true when I'm using new (for me)
> software like Junit.
> 
> How do you=
 Junit veterans assure yourself that a test is 
> actually running and doin=
g what it should be doing?

Heavy doses of alcohol do wonder for me :-)

Mo=
re seriously, the HTML (or wherever you generate them) reports will help
yo=
u make sure your tests pass, and if you are not quite sure of yourself,
som=
e redundancy in your tests doesn't hurt either (testing the same feature
tw=
ice in slightly modified ways in two different places).

But at some point,=
 you really have to trust that your code is really being
executed and it ta=
kes a little leap of faith to get there (especially when
you are testing a =
testing framework with itself, which was the case in the
early days of Test=
NG :-)).
